name: Anthony Raynor
text: Pleasantly surprised.  I had the Italian. The sandwich was generous in size.  The bread was soft with a crisp crust.  Good meat with lots of vegetables. The oil and vinegar provides a nice bite.  Only negative was they included tomato when I asked for it to be without.  Then again that happens almost all of the time at all restaurants.

name: Sanmit Adhikari
text: This is a great place to get delicious grilled sandwiches. I usually go for the large chicken vermonter or the steak bomb sandwich, and it was well worth the $9. It can easily feed two people. â€¦More

name: Jennifer Rajaseharan
text: The most juiciest sandwiches ever! A large sandwich can easily feed two people. Order the steak no. 9! A large sandwich is about 10$ with tax.. And they have great deals now.. Buy 2 get 1 free..

name: James Doyle
text: Average D'Angelo location with all the standard sandwich offerings and a fast-food vibe as it is counter service and located within the larger Cambridgeside Galleria mall food court. Short walk from the MBTA "green line" Lechmere subway station. Paid parking in the garage below the mall.

name: Nicholas Demusz
text: The cleanliness of this place and quality of meat is extremely disturbing, after a couple bites of my sandwich I realized it was riddled with hairs. Will not be returning. Strongly discourage eating here if you value your health.

name: ccmiersdorf7
text:
Very good options you can choose from...I liked the grilled section especially
Every sandwich is also available as rice bowl, but I would recommend the sandwiches

name: Nick Ortiz
text: I love edwin, irving, alvaro and the rest of the crew. I am so welcomed here with the up most respect and gratitude. I be coming here every day and i love the good services they provide. Go team Cambridge.  Love you guys.

name: Chris Perez
text: make your own burger menu is the best and best burgers  ever 100 % ðŸ‘Œ A + best-selling  subs

name: john lewis
text: This place is horrible. I've been at a job across the street for 5 weeks and they give me different prices for stuff that's not on the menu (like side salads) every other day. The manager just told me a side, not small, is only supposed to be .89 less than a large. How does that make sense.
